Comments_List: A better grasp of the major figures and texts in the field of Philosophy, particularly those working on the problem of evil.

Strengths: DeRose is a fantastic teacher, very passionate about the material. Also, I think this should be a required course in the Divinity school.

Weakness: Lectures were sometimes disorganized or disconnected from the readings of the day, and we did not follow the syllabus in terms of major assignments.
Yes, I would. The class discussion was engaging and we had wonderful reading selections!
Absolutely. Dr. DeRose does a wonderful job of helping students find an outlet of passionate inquiry in the class. The questions of this course are relevant to theists and non-theists alike.
